page.title: 02Mining At Markham.
page.content: This year 1985 has just seen the end of a year long miners{Strike.}It started in March 1984 and finished almost exactly a year later. The strike started because{Mr. Ian {MacGregor}wished to close down some of the pits. Since then some people have been injured in disturbances. Today the average miner gets Â£95 a week. Unfortunately the outlook in our coalfield is not very promising. Recently there has been speculation that some pits may have to close. {Markham Colliery}is the biggest pit in our area and there is another pit at Stanfree. The clearest evidence of mining in the area is the huge slurry tips of mine waste that have now been grassed over in part. Several of these tips can be seen in the area.
